what: 1. Compute the singlecell and celltype result for monocytecount trait
title: The common usage and result explaination for scPagwas
text: running scPagwas multi-core server environment, may cause error: Error: Two levels parallelism used. See ?assert_cores\` add code call R environment: need run code window system. example, run scPagwas usual step, running singlecell celltype process. Sometimes, need remove objects cache folder:
code: export OPENBLAS_NUM_THREADS=1 library(scPagwas) Pagwas<-scPagwas_main(Pagwas =NULL,                      gwas_data="monocytecount_prune_gwas_data.txt",                      Single_data ="Seu_Hema_data.rds",                      output.prefix="monocytecount_scPagwas",                      output.dirs="monocytecount_bmmc",                      Pathway_list=Genes_by_pathway_kegg,                      n.cores=2,                      assay="RNA",                      singlecell=T,                       celltype=T,                      block_annotation = block_annotation,                      chrom_ld = chrom_ld) if(length(SOAR::Objects())>0){  SOAR::Remove(SOAR::Objects())  }

title: The common usage and result explaination for scPagwas
text: two types result, Seruat format return result files output; running time relatively long, can download result files

title: The common usage and result explaination for scPagwas
text: Seruat result, two new assays added: scPagwasPaPca: assay S4 type data; svd score result pathways cells; scPagwasPaHeritability: assay S4 type data; gPas score matrix pathways cells; meta.data, four columns added: scPagwas.TRS.Score1: inheritance related score, enrichment socre genetics top genes; scPagwas.gPAS.score: Inheritance pathway regression effects score cells; CellpValue: Ranked CellpValue cells; CellqValue: Ranked CellqValue cells, adjust p value. new element names misc added scPagwas’s result, Pagwas@misc list including: Pathway_list: filtered pathway gene list; pca_cell_df: pahtway celltype data frame pathway svd(1’st pca) result celltype; lm_results: regression result celltype; gene_heritability_correlation: heritability correlation value gene; bootstrap_results: bootstrap data frame results celltypes including bootstrap pvalue confidence interval.
code: > print(Pagwas) An object of class Seurat  16488 features across 35582 samples within 3 assays  Active assay: RNA (15860 features, 5000 variable features)  2 other assays present: scPagwasPaHeritability, scPagwasPaPca  3 dimensional reductions calculated: pca, tsne, umap  > names(Pagwas@misc) [1] "Pathway_list"                  "pca_cell_df"                   [3] "lm_results"                    "bootstrap_results"             [5] "scPathways_rankPvalue"         "gene_heritability_correlation"

title: The common usage and result explaination for scPagwas
text: monocytecount_bmmc folder, several result files : *_cellytpes_bootstrap_results.csv : result cellytpes bootstrap p results; *_gene_heritability_correlation.csv : result gene heritability correlation gPAS score. *_Pathway_singlecell_lm_results.txt : regression result pahtway single cell matrix; *_singlecell_Pathways_scGene_ranlP.csv : ranked pvalue eache singlecell; *_singlecell_scPagwas_score_pvalue.Result.csv : data frame result cell inlcuding scPagwas.TRS.Score, scPagwas.gPAS.score, pValueHighScale, qValueHighScale; scPagwas_cache temporary folder save SOAR data, can remove finish scPagwas.

what: 3.1 Visualize the scPagwas Score of single cell data in UMAP or TSNE plot.
title: The common usage and result explaination for scPagwas
text: DimPlot singlecell data.  scPagwas.TRS.Score1 positive(p<0.05) cells showing dimplot. scPagwas.gPAS.score dimplot.  scPagwas.TRS.Score dimplot.  scPagwas_CellScaleqValue dimplot.  Positive cells(q value<0.05): red dot; Negative cells: dot.
code: require("RColorBrewer")  require("Seurat")  require("SeuratObject")  require("ggsci")  require("dplyr")  require("ggplot2")  require("ggpubr")  #check the objects color26 <- c("#D9DD6B","#ECEFA4","#D54C4C","#8D2828","#FDD2BF","#E98580","#DF5E5E","#492F10","#334257","#476072","#548CA8","#00A19D","#ECD662","#5D8233","#284E78","#3E215D","#835151","#F08FC0","#C6B4CE","#BB8760","#FFDADA","#3C5186","#558776","#E99497","#FFBD9B","#0A1D37")  Seurat::DimPlot(Pagwas,pt.size=1,reduction="tsne",label = T, repel=TRUE)+  scale_colour_manual(name = "celltypes", values = color26)+  umap_theme()+ggtitle("Monocyte BMMC")+labs(x="TSNE",y="")+theme(aspect.ratio=1) scPagwas_Visualization(Single_data=Pagwas,                         p_thre = 0.05,                         FigureType = "tsne",                         width = 7,                         height = 7,                         lowColor = "white",                          highColor = "red",                         output.dirs="figure",                         size = 0.5,                         do_plot = T)

path: /articles/Conventional Parameters and Usage Instructions with Demo Example Data.html
title: Conventional Parameters and Usage Instructions with Demo Example Data
text: Parameters Descriptions scPagwas: Pagwas = NULL: parameter typically required need input data. seurat_return = FALSE, intermediate data stored “Pagwas” list returned result. result can inherited used input subsequent calculations. certain scenarios, performing two computations single-cell data input different GWAS data inputs, result list obtained first computation can used “Pagwas” parameter input second computation. allows skipping single-cell calculations, significantly expediting process. However, seurat_return = TRUE, returned result manipulated manner, final Seurat result many intermediate data removed. gwas_data = NULL: user needs provide address dataframe GWAS data. Specific formatting requirements can found “Introduction Data Input Preprocessing scPagwas”. output.prefix = “Test”: parameter sets prefix output result files. output.dirs = “scPagwastest_output”: parameter specifies directory output result files. block_annotation = block_annotation: genomic annotation file, typically provided scPagwas unless otherwise specified. Single_data = NULL: single-cell data Seurat format, preprocessed annotated information stored Idents. specific processing steps, refer “Introduction Data Input Preprocessing scPagwas”. assay = “RNA”: name assay single-cell data used computation. Pathway_list = Genes_by_pathway_kegg: Pathway data, represented list containing multiple pathways respective gene sets. scPagwas provides various pathway data options, can found “Introduction Data Input Preprocessing scPagwas”. chrom_ld = chrom_ld: LD (Linkage Disequilibrium) information file, typically provided scPagwas. run_split = FALSE: parameter used data subsetting computation. scenarios server’s memory insufficient handle large-scale single-cell data, data can split computation. results integrated analysis. strategy explained section titled “Strategies Large-scale Single-cell Data Subsetting Computation”. n.cores = 1: parameter enables multi-core computation, specifically sixth step scPagwas, “Link_pathway_blocks_gwas” function. marg = 10000: boundary distance base pairs Transcription Start Site (TSS) position. default set 10 kb, resulting window size 20 kb. maf_filter = 0.01: Filtering threshold Minor Allele Frequency (MAF) GWAS data. step helps filter SNPs, reducing total number SNPs computational efficiency. MAF value impact final results. min_clustercells = 10: Filtering criterion clusters single-cell annotation. clusters minimum number cells specified parameter considered. min.pathway.size = 5: Filtering criterion pathway data. pathways gene count less 5 included analysis. max.pathway.size = 300: Filtering criterion pathway data. pathways gene count greater 300 included analysis. Note computation, filtering criteria ensure number expressed genes pathway less 5 300. helps prevent abnormal pathway calculations. However, means different single-cell datasets pathway data, pathways included analysis may vary. filtered pathway data can found “misc” section scPagwas results. iters_celltype = 200: Number iterations bootstrap computation cell-type p-values. iters_singlecell = 100: Number iterations background-corrected single-cell p-value computation. Note parameter significantly affects computation time. n_topgenes = 1000: Number top genes selected calculating Transcriptional Regulator Score (TRS). , follow common practice selecting 1000 genes. singlecell = TRUE: Whether generate single-cell results. celltype = TRUE: Whether generate cell-type results. seurat_return = TRUE: Whether output results Seurat format. parameter effective singlecell = TRUE. remove_outlier = TRUE: Whether filter outliers. Please note descriptions provided parameters scPagwas.

code: #pcc gene for all gPas score! Pagwas$PCC <- scPagwas::scGet_PCC(scPagwas.gPAS.score=Pagwas$scPagwas.gPAS.score,                                     data_mat=Pagwas$data_mat)

path: /articles/Conventional Parameters and Usage Instructions with Demo Example Data.html
what: 3.10 Calculate the TRS score for top genes.
title: Conventional Parameters and Usage Instructions with Demo Example Data
text: Calculate TRS score top genes AddModuleScore running p value cell Get_CorrectBg_p. Single_data$scPagwas.TRS.Score1 : Trait relevant score based top trait relevant genes. Single_data$scPagwas.downTRS.Score2: Trait relevant score based anti-relevant genes. Note: Although article primarily focuses TRS scores, imply reverse “downTRS” always devoid significance. following research, observed certain phenotypes, cancer traits.observing density distribution plot gPas scores, becomes evident exhibits high sharp peak. indicates majority cells minor effects. However, distribution shows pronounced long-tail behavior, direction long tail can influence impact PCC gene pairs phenotype. words, specific genotypes may closely related reduced risk phenotype. However, requires case--case analysis. question arises: GWAS genetic effect mainly positive negative impact phenotypes? factors determine impact? highly intriguing question intend explore subsequent research. encourage researchers consider distribution scPagwas.gPAS.score adjunctive factor assessing directionality, though absolute analyzed case--case basis. Random_Correct_BG_pdf : Dataframe containing calculated results p-values background correction TRS cell, including pooled_p, adj_p, pooled_z, results. Merged_celltype_pvalue : P-value results cell types merging p-values single cells. sub-functions scPagwas can running dependently, need run orderly. scPagwas_main function wrapper functions sub-functions.
code: #Obtain the top 500 genes with the highest PCC. n_topgenes=500 scPagwas_topgenes <- rownames(Pagwas$PCC)[order(Pagwas$PCC, decreasing = T)[1:n_topgenes]] scPagwas_downgenes <- rownames(Pagwas$PCC)[order(Pagwas$PCC, decreasing =F)[1:n_topgenes]]  #Single_data refers to the single-cell data initially inputted. Single_data <- Seurat::AddModuleScore(Single_data, assay = "RNA", list(scPagwas_topgenes,scPagwas_downgenes), name = c("scPagwas.TRS.Score","scPagwas.downTRS.Score"))  #Calculate the p-values for scPagwas.TRS.Score of single cells after background correction. correct_pdf<-Get_CorrectBg_p(Single_data=Single_data,                              scPagwas.TRS.Score=Single_data$scPagwas.TRS.Score1,                              iters_singlecell=100,                              n_topgenes=1000,                              assay="RNA",                              scPagwas_topgenes=scPagwas_topgenes) Pagwas$Random_Correct_BG_pdf <- correct_pdf  #Merge the p-values of cells belonging to the same cell type into a single p-value for each cell type. Pagwas$Merged_celltype_pvalue<-Merge_celltype_p(single_p=correct_pdf$pooled_p,celltype=Pagwas$Celltype_anno$annotation)  #Integrate and output the results of single-cell analysis. a <- data.frame(      scPagwas.TRS.Score = Single_data$scPagwas.TRS.Score1,     scPagwas.downTRS.Score = Single_data$scPagwas.downTRS.Score2,      scPagwas.gPAS.score = Pagwas$scPagwas.gPAS.score,      Random_Correct_BG_p = correct_pdf$pooled_p,      Random_Correct_BG_adjp = correct_pdf$adj_p,      Random_Correct_BG_z = correct_pdf$pooled_z) utils::write.csv(a,file = "_singlecell_scPagwas_score_pvalue.Result.csv",quote = F)

text: Data Results Output scPagwas: default (seurat_return = TRUE), scPagwas returns data results Seurat format, ensures consistency input single-cell data format. scPagwas results Seurat format include two additional assays, five new columns meta.data, five new columns misc data. output folder, five result files along empty folder named “scPagwas_cache”. Generally, “scPagwas_cache” folder unnecessary can deleted without affecting results.

path: /articles/Conventional result and visualization Instructions with Real-World Examples.html
title: Conventional result and visualization Instructions with Real-World Examples
text: Seruat result, two new assays added: scPagwasPaPca: assay S4 type data; svd score result pathways cells; scPagwasPaHeritability: assay S4 type data; gPas score matrix pathways cells; two files intermediate files generated scPagwas. meta.data, four columns added: scPagwas.TRS.Score1: inheritance related score, enrichment socre genetics top genes; scPagwas.upTRS.Score: Trait relevant score based genetic relevant genes scPagwas.downTRS.Score: Trait relevant score based anti-genetic relevant genes scPagwas.gPAS.score: Inheritance pathway regression effects score cells; Random_Correct_BG_p: CellpValue cells; Random_Correct_BG_adjp: fdr cells, adjust p value. Random_Correct_BG_z：z score eahc cells. new element names misc added scPagwas’s result, Pagwas@misc list including: Pathway_list: filtered pathway gene list; pca_cell_df: pahtway celltype data frame pathway svd(1’st pca) result celltype; lm_results: regression result celltype; PCC: pearson correlation coefficients,heritability correlation value gene; PCC_up: pearson correlation coefficients, high heritability correlation value high gPas score cells PCC_down: pearson correlation coefficients, Low heritability correlation value Low gPas score cells bootstrap_results: bootstrap data frame results celltypes including bootstrap pvalue confidence interval. Merged_celltype_pvalue: resulting Merged_celltype_pvalue represents p-values cell type level, differ bootstrap_results. bootstrap_results based merging cell-level expression data cell type-level expression data performing calculations. contrast, Merged_celltype_pvalue derived Random_Correct_BG_p results, combining p-values cells within specific cell type single p-value result cell type. Note: Although bootstrap merged strategies yield cell type-level results, may identical. bootstrap approach calculates p-values based pseudo-bulk data, can differ results obtained single-cell calculations. contrast, merged strategy directly integrates results single-cell calculations, resulting greater consistency single-cell results. primary focus scPagwas paper bootstrap_results; however, later stages development, discovered discrepancies cell type-level single-cell-level calculation strategies posed challenges downstream analyses. Hence, new version development, directly utilize integration single-cell results obtain cell type-level p-values. Additionally, major advantage bootstrap_results speed, calculation Random_Correct_BG_p single cells requires least 100 iterations, making computationally demanding. avoid calculating Random_Correct_BG_p, setting parameter iters_singlecell=0 good option.
code: > print(Pagwas) An object of class Seurat  16478 features across 35582 samples within 3 assays  Active assay: RNA (15860 features, 5000 variable features)  2 other assays present: scPagwasPaHeritability, scPagwasPaPca  3 dimensional reductions calculated: pca, tsne, umap  > names(Pagwas@misc) [1] "Pathway_list"                  "pca_cell_df"                   "lm_results"                    [4] "bootstrap_results"             "scPathways_rankPvalue"         "GeneticExpressionIndex" [7] "Merged_celltype_pvalue"

code: library(Seurat) library(SeuratObject) counts <- read.csv("/Users/chunyudeng/Downloads/GSE115978_counts.csv.gz",row.names=1) Anno<- read.csv("/Users/chunyudeng/Downloads/GSE115978_cell.annotations.csv.gz") ##create the SeuratObject Single_data<-Seurat::CreateSeuratObject(   counts,   assay = "RNA",   meta.data=Anno )  Idents(Single_data)<-Single_data$cell.types Single_data <- NormalizeData(Single_data, normalization.method = "LogNormalize", scale.factor = 10000) Single_data <- ScaleData(Single_data)

Among six columns typically present GWAS summary file, “maf” column primarily used scPagwas SNP filtering purposes. allows reduction SNP quantity computational burden. However, play critical role analysis. workaround, possible customize column include value minimum minor allele frequency (maf), essentially bypassing maf filtering step. modification significant impact results since scPagwas aims integrate larger number SNP data, regardless magnitude effects. GWAS summary data, effect size (ES) standard error (SE) SNP locus typically provided. cases beta data unavailable, possible compute conversion using following formula: beta = ES / SE , beta represents effect size SNP locus. Alternatively, ES column can used represent impact SNP locus target trait. Therefore, replacing beta column ES values directly scPagwas calculations also acceptable. However, important maintain consistent column names per example data. Additionally, TXT files data frames acceptable formats input data. Please note scPagwas analysis supports adaptations accommodate GWAS summary files perfectly align standard requirements.

code: library(KEGGREST) pathways.list <- keggList("pathway", "hsa") # Pull all genes for each pathway pathway.codes <- sub("path:", "", names(pathways.list))  genes.by.pathway_kegg <- sapply(pathways.list,                            function(pwid){                              pw <- keggGet(pwid)                              if (is.null(pw[[1]]$GENE)) return(NA)                              pw2 <- pw[[1]]$GENE[c(FALSE,TRUE)] # may need to modify this to c(FALSE, TRUE) for other organisms                              pw2 <- unlist(lapply(strsplit(pw2, split = ";", fixed = T), function(x)x[1]))                              return(pw2)                            })

what: Prepare the Single cell data firstly

what: Prune the gwas summary statistics file by plink
title: Prune_GwasSummaryFIles_plink
text: markdown editing!! ## 处理gwas数据
code: GWAS_raw <-read_table(paste("./",x,".gz",sep=""))   GWAS_raw<-GWAS_raw[,c(1,2,3,4,5,6,9,10)]   colnames(GWAS_raw)<-c("chrom","pos","REF","ALT","rsid","nearest_genes","beta","se")   GWAS_raw$maf<-0.1      write.table(GWAS_raw,file=paste("./",tolower(x),".txt",sep=""),row.names=F,quote=F)

previous_headings: Prune the gwas summary statistics file by plink
title: Prune_GwasSummaryFIles_plink
code: mkdir tempfile for i in finngen_r7_c3_breast_exallc do awk  '{print $5 }' ${i}.txt  > ./tempfile/${i}_SNP_list.txt done for i in $(seq 1 22)   do  echo $i plink  --bfile ./02_partitioned_LD_score_estimation/1000G_EUR_Phase3_plink/1000G.EUR.QC.$i  --extract ./tempfile/${j}_SNP_list.txt  --noweb --make-bed --out ./tempfile/1000G.EUR.QC.${j}_${i}_filtered done

previous_headings: Prune the gwas summary statistics file by plink
title: Prune_GwasSummaryFIles_plink
code: for i in $(seq 1 22)   do  echo $i plink  --bfile ./tempfile/1000G.EUR.QC.${j}_${i}_filtered  --indep-pairwise 50 5 0.8  --out  ./tempfile/${j}_${i}_plink_prune_EUR_filtered_LD0.8 done

code: cat [${j}]*.prune.in > ${j}_EUR_LD0.8.prune

previous_headings: Prune the gwas summary statistics file by plink
title: Prune_GwasSummaryFIles_plink
code: library(readr) library(dplyr)  for (i in c("finngen_r7_c3_breast_herneg_exallc")) {     print(i)     gwas<-read_table(paste0("./",i,".txt"))     SNP_prune<- read_table(paste0("./finngen_R7/tempfile/",i,"_EUR_LD0.8.prune"))     SNP_prune<-SNP_prune[!duplicated(unlist(SNP_prune)),]     colnames(SNP_prune)<-"rsid"     #### Left Join using inner_join function     gwas= gwas %>% inner_join(SNP_prune,by="rsid")     print(nrow(gwas))    write.table(gwas,file= paste0("./",i,"_prune.txt"),,row.names=F,quote=F)         print(i) #gc() }

path: /articles/Pruning Process for GWAS Summary Statistics File in scPagwas.html
what: Pruning Process for GWAS Summary Statistics File in scPagwas
title: Pruning Process for GWAS Summary Statistics File in scPagwas
text: GWAS summary statistics file needs provided users. However, many cases, number SNPs files can reach ten millions, can significantly impact computing time. Therefore, recommended preprocess file using Plink software’s prune function inputting . prune function commonly used tool Plink software selects representative SNPs LD loci, reduces number highly similar loci, lowers false-positive rate, thereby improving result reliability. Furthermore, process significantly impact final result. Hence, advisable use method GWAS file large.

title: Running_scPagwas_steps_by_SubFunctions
text: different situations running scPagwas!

what: 1.1. Run both singlecell and celltypes functions.
title: Running_scPagwas_steps_by_SubFunctions
text: colomn “scPagwas.TRS.Score1”,“scPagwas.gPAS.score” trait relavent score genetic pathway score cells. colomn “CellpValue” , “CellqValue” statistics p value trait relavent score cells. “bootstrap_results” cell type results; “scPathways_rankPvalue” p value pahtway celltype; “gene_heritability_correlation” correlation result gene genetic pathway score, top genes used calculating trait relavent score. “Pathway_list” ,“pca_cell_df” “lm_results” intermediate results scPagwas. intermediate results “scPagwasPaHeritability” “scPagwasPaPca” additional assays scPagwas. - “scPagwasPaHeritability” Heritability score pahtway cell. - “scPagwasPaPca” pca score pahtway cell.
code: library(scPagwas) Pagwas<-scPagwas_main(Pagwas =NULL,                      gwas_data =system.file("extdata", "GWAS_summ_example.txt", package = "scPagwas"),                      Single_data =system.file("extdata", "scRNAexample.rds", package = "scPagwas"),                      output.prefix="Test",                      output.dirs="Test",                      Pathway_list=Genes_by_pathway_kegg,                      assay="RNA",                      singlecell=T,                       celltype=T,                      block_annotation = block_annotation,                      chrom_ld = chrom_ld) print(Pagwas) names(Pagwas@meta.data) # [1] "orig.ident"          "nCount_RNA"          "nFeature_RNA"        "percent.mt"          # [5] "S.Score"             "G2M.Score"           "Phase"               "old.ident"           # [9] "nCount_SCT"          "nFeature_SCT"        "SCT_snn_res.0.5"     "seurat_clusters"     #[13] "SCT_snn_res.0.4"     "SCT_snn_res.0.8"     "anno"                "scPagwas.TRS.Score1" #[17] "scPagwas.gPAS.score" "CellpValue"          "CellqValue" names(Pagwas@misc) #[1] "Pathway_list"                  "pca_cell_df"                   #[3] "lm_results"                    "bootstrap_results"             #[5] "scPathways_rankPvalue"         "gene_heritability_correlation" names(Pagwas@assays) #[1] "RNA"                    "SCT"                    "scPagwasPaHeritability" #[4] "scPagwasPaPca"

title: Running_scPagwas_steps_by_SubFunctions
text: executive programs celltypes single cell independent, want know celtypes, set celltype=T singlecell=F. advantages save lot times, celltype can omit many running processes. reuslt celltypes list format(seurat format). bootstrap_results: bootstrap data frame results celltypes including bootstrap pvalue confidence interval. pca_scCell_mat : pahtway cell data matrix pathway svd(1’st pca) result cell; pca_cell_df : pahtway celltype data matrix pathway svd(1’st pca) result celltype; elements intermediate data.
code: library(scPagwas) Pagwas_celltypes<-scPagwas_main(Pagwas =NULL,                      gwas_data =system.file("extdata", "GWAS_summ_example.txt", package = "scPagwas"),                      Single_data =system.file("extdata", "scRNAexample.rds", package = "scPagwas"),                      output.prefix="Test",                      output.dirs="Test",                      Pathway_list=Genes_by_pathway_kegg,                      assay="RNA",                      singlecell=F,                       celltype=T,                      block_annotation = block_annotation,                      chrom_ld = chrom_ld) names(Pagwas_celltypes) # [1] "Celltype_anno"     "data_mat"          "VariableFeatures"  # [4] "merge_scexpr"      "rawPathway_list"   "Pathway_list"      # [7] "pca_scCell_mat"    "pca_cell_df"       "snp_gene_df"       #[10] "lm_results"        "bootstrap_results

title: Running_scPagwas_steps_by_SubFunctions
text: parameters input data celltypes function, can take celltypes result input data single cell function. advantage need run svd code block, save lot time. result seurat format.
code: Pagwas_singlecell<-scPagwas_main(Pagwas =Pagwas_celltypes,                                   gwas_data =system.file("extdata", "GWAS_summ_example.txt", package = "scPagwas"),                                  Single_data =system.file("extdata", "scRNAexample.rds", package = "scPagwas"),                                  output.prefix="Test",                                  output.dirs="Test",                                  Pathway_list=Genes_by_pathway_kegg,                                  assay="RNA",                                  singlecell=T,                                   celltype=F,                                  block_annotation = block_annotation,                                  chrom_ld = chrom_ld)

title: Running_scPagwas_steps_by_SubFunctions
text: utilize understand scPagwas better, run scPagwas flexibly step step. usual, needn’t run sub-functions one one. steps can founded ‘scPagwas_main’ functions. use example provided scPagwas package.

title: Running_scPagwas_steps_by_SubFunctions
text: Obtain single cell expression matrix filter cluster minimum cells. result list including single cell expression matrix cell types mean expression matrix.
code: library(scPagwas) Pagwas <- list() Single_data <- readRDS(system.file("extdata", "scRNAexample.rds", package = "scPagwas")) Pagwas <- Single_data_input(       Pagwas = Pagwas,       assay = "RNA",       Single_data = Single_data,       Pathway_list = Genes_by_pathway_kegg     ) Single_data <- Single_data[, colnames(Pagwas$data_mat)] names(Pagwas)

title: Running_scPagwas_steps_by_SubFunctions
text: Obtain pathway pca score matrix. result list including pca_scCell_mat single cell pca score matrix pca_cell_df cell types pca score matrix.
code: Pagwas <- Pathway_pcascore_run(         Pagwas = Pagwas,         Pathway_list = Genes_by_pathway_kegg       ) names(Pagwas)

title: Running_scPagwas_steps_by_SubFunctions
text: Read GWAS summary data, remove MHC sex chromosome filtered maf SNP.
code: gwas_data <- bigreadr::fread2(system.file("extdata", "GWAS_summ_example.txt", package = "scPagwas")) Pagwas <- GWAS_summary_input(     Pagwas = Pagwas,     gwas_data = gwas_data,     maf_filter = 0.1   ) names(Pagwas)

title: Running_scPagwas_steps_by_SubFunctions
text: set marg 10KB, means position SNP less 10KB distance TSS gene. SNP gene dataframe:
code: Pagwas$snp_gene_df <- SnpToGene(         gwas_data = Pagwas$gwas_data,         block_annotation = block_annotation,         marg = 10000       ) knitr::kable(head(Pagwas$snp_gene_df))

title: Running_scPagwas_steps_by_SubFunctions
text: Mapping SNPs pahtways getting block data.
code: Pagwas <- Pathway_annotation_input(       Pagwas = Pagwas,       block_annotation = block_annotation     ) names(Pagwas) Pagwas$pathway_blocks[1:3]

what: 3.6 Link the pathway blocks to pca score
title: Running_scPagwas_steps_by_SubFunctions
text: Also run regression function single cell. pathway regression result single cell.
code: Pagwas <- Link_pathway_blocks_gwas(       Pagwas = Pagwas,       chrom_ld = chrom_ld,       singlecell = T,       celltype = T,       backingpath="./temp") knitr::kable(Pagwas$Pathway_sclm_results[1:10,1:5])

title: Running_scPagwas_steps_by_SubFunctions
text: Run regression function celltypes. Show regression result celltypes.
code: Pagwas$lm_results <- Pagwas_perform_regression(Pathway_ld_gwas_data = Pagwas$Pathway_ld_gwas_data) Pagwas <- Boot_evaluate(Pagwas, bootstrap_iters = 200, part = 0.5) Pagwas$Pathway_ld_gwas_data <- NULL names(Pagwas) Pagwas$lm_results knitr::kable(Pagwas$bootstrap_results)

title: Running_scPagwas_steps_by_SubFunctions
text: gPAS scPagwas score mainly deal single-cell regression result. Show result Pathway pvalue cell types
code: Pagwas <- scPagwas_perform_score(       Pagwas = Pagwas,       remove_outlier = TRUE     ) names(Pagwas) Pagwas$scPagwas.gPAS.score[1:10] knitr::kable(head(Pagwas$scPathways_rankPvalue))

title: Running_scPagwas_steps_by_SubFunctions
text: Run heritability correlation genes. result correlation:
code: Pagwas$gene_heritability_correlation <- scGet_gene_heritability_correlation(scPagwas.gPAS.score=Pagwas$scPagwas.gPAS.score,                                                                                 data_mat=Pagwas$data_mat) knitr::kable(head(Pagwas$gene_heritability_correlation))

what: 3.10 Calculate the TRS score for top genes.
title: Running_scPagwas_steps_by_SubFunctions
text: Calculate TRS score top genes AddModuleScore running p value cell rankPvalue. sub-functions scPagwas can running dependently, need run orderly. scPagwas_main function wrapper functions sub-functions.
code: scPagwas_topgenes <- names(Pagwas$gene_heritability_correlation[order(Pagwas$gene_heritability_correlation, decreasing = T), ])[1:1000]  Single_data <- Seurat::AddModuleScore(Single_data, assay = "RNA", list(scPagwas_topgenes), name = c("scPagwas.TRS.Score")) #run pvalue CellScalepValue <- scGene_scaleP(       Single_mat = t(data.matrix(         Seurat::GetAssayData(Single_data, assay = 'RNA')[scPagwas_topgenes, ]       ))     )

what: 4.1 Visualize the scPagwas Score of single cell data in UMAP or TSNE plot.
title: Running_scPagwas_steps_by_SubFunctions
text: DimPlot singlecell data. scPagwas.TRS.Score1 positive(p<0.05) cells showing dimplot.
code: suppressMessages(require("RColorBrewer"))  suppressMessages(require("Seurat"))  suppressMessages(require("SeuratObject"))  suppressMessages(require("ggsci"))  suppressMessages(require("dplyr"))  suppressMessages(require("ggplot2"))  suppressMessages(require("ggpubr"))  Seurat::DimPlot(Pagwas,pt.size=1,reduction="umap",label = T, repel=TRUE)+  umap_theme()+ggtitle("Test")+labs(x="UMAP",y="")+theme(aspect.ratio=1) scPagwas_Visualization(Single_data=Pagwas_singlecell,                         p_thre = 0.05,                         FigureType = "umap",                         width = 7,                         height = 7,                         lowColor = "white",                          highColor = "red",                         output.dirs="figure",                         size = 0.5,                         do_plot = T)

what: 4.2 Plot the barplot of the proportion of positive Cell.
title: Running_scPagwas_steps_by_SubFunctions
text: Plot barplot proportion positive Cells celltypes: Plot barplot proportion celltypes positive negative Cells:
code: plot_bar_positie_nagtive(seurat_obj=Pagwas_singlecell,                          var_ident="anno",                          var_group="positiveCells",                          vec_group_colors=c("#E8D0B3","#7EB5A6"),                          do_plot = T) plot_bar_positie_nagtive(seurat_obj=Pagwas_singlecell,                               var_ident="positiveCells",                               var_group="anno",                               p_thre = 0.01,                               vec_group_colors=NULL,                               f_color=colorRampPalette(brewer.pal(n=10, name="RdYlBu")),                               do_plot = T)

title: Running_scPagwas_steps_by_SubFunctions
code: heritability_cor_scatterplot(gene_heri_cor=Pagwas_singlecell@misc$gene_heritability_correlation,                              topn_genes_label=10,                              color_low="#035397",                              color_high ="#F32424",                              color_mid = "white",                              text_size=2,                              do_plot=T,                              max.overlaps =20,                              width = 7,                              height = 7)

what: 4.4 Show expression of the top heritability correlation genes in celltypes
title: Running_scPagwas_steps_by_SubFunctions
code: suppressMessages(library("ggsci")) suppressMessages(library("Seurat")) top5genes<-rownames(Pagwas_singlecell@misc$gene_heritability_correlation)[order(Pagwas_singlecell@misc$gene_heritability_correlation,decreasing = T)[c(4,30,36,55)]] plot_vln_Corgenes(seurat_obj=Pagwas_singlecell,              assay="RNA", slot="data",              var_group="anno",              vec_features=top5genes,              do_plot = T              )

title: Running_scPagwas_steps_by_SubFunctions
text: Barplot celltypes Forest plot estimate value.
code: Bootstrap_P_Barplot(p_results=Pagwas_singlecell@misc$bootstrap_results$bp_value[-1],                     p_names=rownames(Pagwas_singlecell@misc$bootstrap_results)[-1],                     width = 5,                     height = 7,                     do_plot=T,                     title = "Test") Bootstrap_estimate_Plot(Pagwas=Pagwas_singlecell,                         width = 9,                         height = 7,                         do_plot=T)

what: Run the scPagwas for big scRNA-seq data

what: Strategies for Large-scale Single-cell Data Subsetting and Computation
title: Strategies for Large-scale Single-cell Data Subsetting and Computation
text: computer storage enough, ignore item. rapid development single-cell data analysis recent years, number single cells also increased significantly. Analyzing entire single-cell expression matrix can sometimes lead memory overflow, making difficult many individuals run scPagwas required amount memory. address issue, provide two solutions corresponding different memory situations: Solution 1: enough memory load single-cell data run “Pathway_pcascore_run” function without encountering memory overflow, solution involves splitting data step. Solution 2: enough memory run “Pathway_pcascore_run” function, solution involves splitting data based initial input single-cell data. Please note approaches specific single-cell data processing. cell type calculations, large memory requirements typically necessary. still insufficient memory, alternative approach randomly select subset single cells, ensuring cell type adequately represented subset. Cell type calculations can performed based subset, represents pseudo-bulk analysis. However, vignette cover cell type calculations.

what: 1.1 Input and compute the single-cell data.
title: Strategies for Large-scale Single-cell Data Subsetting and Computation
text: Solution 1 involves following scPagwas workflow proceeding calculations second step:
code: library(scPagwas) Pagwas <- list() #Input and preprocess the single-cell data Single_data <- readRDS(system.file("extdata", "scRNAexample.rds", package = "scPagwas")) Pagwas <- scPagwas::Single_data_input(       Pagwas = Pagwas,       assay = "RNA",       Single_data = Single_data,       Pathway_list = Genes_by_pathway_kegg     ) Single_data <- Single_data[, colnames(Pagwas$data_mat)]  #Run svd function Pagwas <- scPagwas::Pathway_pcascore_run(         Pagwas = Pagwas,         Pathway_list = Genes_by_pathway_kegg       )  Pagwas <- scPagwas::pa_meanexpr(Pagwas) #save this result save(Pagwas,file="./single.pagwas.RData")

what: 1.4 The core computational pathway for the regression process
title: Strategies for Large-scale Single-cell Data Subsetting and Computation
text: Given divided single-cell results two partitions, following code illustrates regression process using one partitions example. , necessary run split single-cell data separately, obtain “_Pathway_sclm_results.RData” result one.
code: gwas_path <- "gwas_pagwas.RData" scmat_path <- "1_Pagwas_singledata.RData" scmat_path <- "2_Pagwas_singledata.RData" scmat_path <- "3_Pagwas_singledata.RData"  #Import and integrate the two data results into a single list. load(gwas_path) Pagwas1<-Pagwas rm(Pagwas) load(scmat_path) Pagwas<- c(Pagwas1,Pagwas)  rm(Pagwas1) gc()  output.prefix='1' output.prefix='2' output.prefix='3' output.dirs='Test' if (!dir.exists(output.dirs)) {     dir.create(output.dirs) } if (!dir.exists(output.dirs)) {   dir.create(paste0("./", output.dirs, "/temp")) }  Pagwas <- scPagwas::Pathway_annotation_input(       Pagwas = Pagwas,       block_annotation = block_annotation     ) Pagwas <- scPagwas::Link_pathway_blocks_gwas(       Pagwas = Pagwas,       chrom_ld = chrom_ld,       singlecell = T,       celltype = F,       backingpath=paste0("./", output.dirs, "/temp"),       n.cores=1       ) pmat<-Pagwas$Pathway_sclm_results  #save result save(pmat,file=paste0("./", output.dirs, "/",output.prefix,"_Pathway_sclm_results.RData")) #save(pmat,file=paste0("./", output.dirs, "/",output.prefix,"_Pathway_sclm_results.RData"))

path: /articles/Strategies for Large-scale Single-cell Data Subsetting and Computation.html
previous_headings: Strategies for Large-scale Single-cell Data Subsetting and Computation > 1.Solution 1
what: 1.6 Calculating the scPagwas.gPAS.score and genetic association gene
title: Strategies for Large-scale Single-cell Data Subsetting and Computation
text: calculating scPagwas.gPAS.score, genetic association gene analysis performed based score. process, 200 cells randomly sampled large-scale single-cell data computation. process repeated five times, results integrated obtain final heritability correlation. number cells randomly selected number random iterations depend specific quantity single cells available.
code: #Note: Here, we need to import the "single.pagwas.RData" data again. load("./single.pagwas.RData") load("pmat_merge.RData")  #compute the gPas score. scPagwas.gPAS.score <- scPagwas::Merge_gPas(Pagwas,pmat_merge)  #compute the heritability correlation for each gene.  PCC<-scPagwas::Corr_Random(Pagwas$data_mat,                            scPagwas.gPAS.score,                            seed=1234,                            random=T,                            Nrandom=5,# you need change this parameter based on your cell numbers.                            Nselect=200 # you need change this parameter based on your cell numbers.                                                      ) mean_gpas<-mean(scPagwas.gPAS.score) a1<-which(scPagwas.gPAS.score >= mean_gpas) a2<-which(scPagwas.gPAS.score < mean_gpas)  PCC_up <- scPagwas::Corr_Random(scPagwas.gPAS.score=scPagwas.gPAS.score[a1],data_mat=Pagwas$data_mat[,a1]) PCC_down <- scPagwas::Corr_Random(scPagwas.gPAS.score=scPagwas.gPAS.score[a2],data_mat=Pagwas$data_mat[,a2])  scPagwas_topgenes <- names(PCC[order(PCC, decreasing = T)])[1:500] scPagwas_upgenes <- names(PCC_up)[order(PCC_up, decreasing = T)[1:500]] scPagwas_downgenes <- names(PCC_down)[order(PCC_down, decreasing = F)[1:500]]

code: Single_data <- Seurat::AddModuleScore(Single_data, assay = 'RNA', list(scPagwas_topgenes,scPagwas_upgenes,scPagwas_downgenes), name = c("scPagwas.TRS.Score","scPagwas.upTRS.Score","scPagwas.downTRS.Score")) correct_pdf <- scPagwas::Get_CorrectBg_p(Single_data=Single_data,                                      scPagwas.TRS.Score=Single_data$scPagwas.TRS.Score1,                                      iters_singlecell=100,                                      n_topgenes=500,                                      scPagwas_topgenes=scPagwas_topgenes)  Pagwas$Random_Correct_BG_pdf <- correct_pdf Pagwas$Merged_celltype_pvalue<-scPagwas::Merge_celltype_p(single_p=correct_pdf$pooled_p,                                                           celltype=Pagwas$Celltype_anno$annotation)

what: 2.4. Integrate the gPAS.score result for splice data.
title: Strategies for Large-scale Single-cell Data Subsetting and Computation
text: Read “_singlecell_scPagwas.gPAS.score.Result.csv” result files integrate together.
code: output.dirs="splice_scPagwas" oriDir <- paste0("./",output.dirs) files <- list.files(oriDir, pattern="*_singlecell_scPagwas.gPAS.score.Result.csv") #integrate the scPagwas.gPAS.score scPagwas.gPAS.score<-unlist(lapply( files,function(file){     gs<-read.csv(file=paste0(oriDir,"/",file))     ga <- gs$scPagwas.gPAS.score     names(ga) <- gs$cellnames     return(ga)   })) Single_data <- Single_data[,names(scPagwas.gPAS.score)] Single_data$scPagwas.gPAS.score<-scPagwas.gPAS.score

path: /articles/Strategies for Large-scale Single-cell Data Subsetting and Computation.html

what: 2.5 Compute the TRS and background correction p-values
title: Strategies for Large-scale Single-cell Data Subsetting and Computation
text: step identical later steps Solution 1.
code: data_mat <- GetAssayData(Single_data, layer = "data", assay = "RNA") PCC<-scPagwas::Corr_Random(data_mat,                            scPagwas.gPAS.score,                            seed=1234,                            random=T,                            Nrandom=5, # you need change this parameter based on your cell numbers.                            Nselect=200 # you need change this parameter based on your cell numbers.                                                      ) mean_gpas<-mean(scPagwas.gPAS.score) a1<-which(scPagwas.gPAS.score >= mean_gpas) a2<-which(scPagwas.gPAS.score < mean_gpas)  PCC_up <- scPagwas::Corr_Random(scPagwas.gPAS.score=scPagwas.gPAS.score[a1],data_mat=data_mat[,a1]) PCC_down <- scPagwas::Corr_Random(scPagwas.gPAS.score=scPagwas.gPAS.score[a2],data_mat=data_mat[,a2])  scPagwas_topgenes <- names(PCC[order(PCC, decreasing = T)])[1:500] scPagwas_upgenes <- names(PCC_up)[order(PCC_up, decreasing = T)[1:500]] scPagwas_downgenes <- names(PCC_down)[order(PCC_down, decreasing = F)[1:500]] Single_data <- Seurat::AddModuleScore(Single_data, assay = 'RNA', list(scPagwas_topgenes,scPagwas_upgenes,scPagwas_downgenes), name = c("scPagwas.TRS.Score","scPagwas.upTRS.Score","scPagwas.downTRS.Score")) correct_pdf <- scPagwas::Get_CorrectBg_p(Single_data=Single_data,                                      scPagwas.TRS.Score=Single_data$scPagwas.TRS.Score1,                                      iters_singlecell=100,                                      n_topgenes=500,                                      scPagwas_topgenes=scPagwas_topgenes) Pagwas$scPagwas.TRS.Score = Single_data$scPagwas.TRS.Score1 Pagwas$Random_Correct_BG_pdf <- correct_pdf Pagwas$Merged_celltype_pvalue<-scPagwas::Merge_celltype_p(single_p=correct_pdf$pooled_p,                                                          celltype=Idents(Single_data))

what: A pathway-based polygenic integration method for inferring disease-associated individual cells in single cell sequencing data
title: A pathway-based polygenic integration method for inferring disease-associated individual cells in single cell sequencing data
text: scPagwas employs polygenic regression model prioritize set trait-relevant genes uncover trait-relevant cell subpopulations incorporating pathway activity transformed single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) data genome-wide association studies (GWAS) summary data.  Please cite article press : Ma et al.,Polygenic regression uncovers trait-relevant cellular contexts pathway activation transformation single-cell RNA sequencing data,Cell Genomics (2023),https://doi.org/10.1016/j.xgen.2023.100383 Code reproducing analysis paper available , usage scPagwas package, can visit website. vignette using also can accessed using browseVignettes(“scPagwas”)

title: A pathway-based polygenic integration method for inferring disease-associated individual cells in single cell sequencing data
text: can install released version scPagwas github : many cases, installing packages using devtools::install_github may fail.
code: #install some dependence packages install.packages("Seurat") install.packages("ggpubr") if (!require("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE))     install.packages("BiocManager") BiocManager::install("GenomicRanges")  devtools::install_github("sulab-wmu/scPagwas") library(devtools) install_git("https://github.com/sulab-wmu/scPagwas.git", ref = "main")

title: A pathway-based polygenic integration method for inferring disease-associated individual cells in single cell sequencing data
text: quick-start example:
code: library(scPagwas) system.time(  #1.start to run the wrapper functions for example.  Pagwas_data<-scPagwas_main(Pagwas = NULL,                      gwas_data =system.file("extdata", "GWAS_summ_example.txt", package = "scPagwas"), # The GWAS Summary statistics files                       Single_data =system.file("extdata", "scRNAexample.rds", package = "scPagwas"),# scRNA-seq data in seruat format with "RNA" assays and normalized.                      output.prefix="test", # the prefix name for output files                      output.dirs="scPagwastest_output",# the directory file's name for output                      block_annotation = block_annotation_hg37,# gene position in chromosome is provided by package. default is hg38, block_annotation_hg37 is hg37.                      assay="RNA", # the assays for scRNA-seq data to use.                      Pathway_list=Genes_by_pathway_kegg,# pathway list is provided by package, including gene symbols.                      n.cores=1,                      iters_singlecell = 10,                      chrom_ld = chrom_ld,# The LD data is provided by package.                      singlecell=T, # Whether to run the singlecell process.                      celltype=T# Whether to run the celltype process. ) )

title: Genes_by_pathway_kegg — Genes_by_pathway_kegg
text: numbers  library(KEGGREST) pathways.list <- keggList("pathway", "hsa") # Pull genes pathway pathway.codes <- sub("path:", "", names(pathways.list)) Genes_by_pathway.kegg <- sapply(pathway.codes,function(pwid){ pw <- keggGet(pwid) (.null(pw[[1]]$GENE)) return(NA) pw2 <- pw[[1]]$GENE[c(FALSE,TRUE)] # may need modify c(FALSE, TRUE) organisms pw2 <- unlist(lapply(strsplit(pw2, split = ";", fixed = T), function(x)x[1]))  return(pw2) })

title: Pathway_pcascore_run — Pathway_pcascore_run
code: library(scPagwas) Pagwas <- list() # Start to read the single cell data Single_data <- readRDS(system.file("extdata", "scRNAexample.rds",   package = "scPagwas" )) Pagwas <- Single_data_input(   Pagwas = Pagwas,   assay = "RNA",   Single_data = Single_data,   Pathway_list = Genes_by_pathway_kegg ) #> Input single cell data! #> 10 cell types are remain, after filter! Single_data <- Single_data[, colnames(Pagwas$data_mat)] # Run pathway pca score! Pagwas <- Pathway_pcascore_run(   Pagwas = Pagwas,   Pathway_list = Genes_by_pathway_kegg ) #> * Start to get Pathway SVD socre! #>    |                                                                               |                                                                      |   0%   |                                                                               |=======                                                               |  10%[1] "Celltype1" #>    |                                                                               |==============                                                        |  20%[1] "Celltype2" #>    |                                                                               |=====================                                                 |  30%[1] "Celltype3" #>    |                                                                               |============================                                          |  40%[1] "Celltype4" #>    |                                                                               |===================================                                   |  50%[1] "Celltype5" #>    |                                                                               |==========================================                            |  60%[1] "Celltype6" #>    |                                                                               |=================================================                     |  70%[1] "Celltype7" #>    |                                                                               |========================================================              |  80%[1] "Celltype8" #>    |                                                                               |===============================================================       |  90%[1] "Celltype9" #>    |                                                                               |======================================================================| 100%[1] "Celltype10" #>  #> Using score as value column: use value.var to override.

text: use vcftools get ped map files LD data  /share/apps/vcftools/bin/vcftools --vcf /share/pub/dengcy/Singlecell/COVID19/1000genomes_all_genotypes.vcf --plink-tped --/share/pub/dengcy/Singlecell/COVID19/1000genomes_all_genotypes/share/pub/dengcy/Singlecell/COVID19/PLINK/plink --tfile /share/pub/dengcy/Singlecell/COVID19/1000genomes_all_genotypes --recode --/share/pub/dengcy/Singlecell/COVID19/1000genomes_all_genotypes /share/pub/dengcy/Singlecell/COVID19/PLINK/plink --map /share/pub/dengcy/Singlecell/COVID19/1000genomes_all_genotypes.map --ped /share/pub/dengcy/Singlecell/COVID19/1000genomes_all_genotypes.ped --allow--sex --autosome --r2 --ld-window-kb 1000 --ld-window-r2 0.2 --/share/pub/dengcy/Singlecell/COVID19/ld_1000genome covid_ld<-read.delim("/share/pub/dengcy/Singlecell/COVID19/ld_1000genome.ld") covid_ld<-covid_ld[!(covid_ld$ colnames(covid_ld)[7]<-"R" lapply(unique(covid_ld$CHR_A), function(){   <-data.table(covid_ld[covid_ld$CHR_A == ,])   file_name <- paste0("/share/pub/dengcy/Singlecell/COVID19/data/LD/",,".Rds")   saveRDS(, file = file_name) })chrom_ld<-lapply(.character(1:22),function(chrom){   chrom_ld_file_path <- paste(ld_folder, '/', chrom, '.Rds', sep = '')  ld_data <- readRDS(chrom_ld_file_path)[(R**2 > r2_threshold), .(SNP_A, SNP_B, R)]   return(ld_data) }) save(chrom_ld,file="/share/pub/dengcy/GWAS_Multiomics/pagwas/data/chrom_ld.RData")

title: genes.by.tft.pathway — genes.by.tft.pathway
text: celltype pathway gene set  x <- readLines("c3.tft.v7.5.1.symbols.gmt") res <- strsplit(x, "\t") names(res) <- vapply(res, function(y) y[1], character(1)) genes..tft.pathway <- lapply(res, "[", -c(1:2))

title: Estimate local False Discovery Rate (FDR) — lfdr
text: p vector p-values (necessary input). pi0 Estimated proportion true null p-values. trunc TRUE, local FDR values >1 set 1. Default TRUE. monotone TRUE, local FDR values non-decreasing increasing p-values. Default TRUE; recommended. transf Either "probit" "logit" transformation applied p-values local FDR estimate can formed involve edge effects c(0,1) interval p-values lie. adj Numeric value applied multiple smoothing bandwidth used density estimation. Default adj=1.0. eps Numeric value threshold tails empirical p-value distribution. Default 10^-8. ... Additional arguments.

code: library(Seurat) #> Attaching SeuratObject scRNAexample <-readRDS(system.file("extdata", "scRNAexample.rds", package = "scPagwas")) #set the output.dirs for any directory. set.dirs="D:/OneDrive/GWAS_Multiomics/Pagwas/test/" #set the number of split time, it depend on the size of your single cell data. #There have two form of spliting the data:  ######### ##1.By Random #Create the random index number. n_split=2 Split_index <- rep(1:n_split, time = ceiling(ncol(scRNAexample)/n_split), length = ncol(scRNAexample))  for (i in 1:n_split) {   Example_splice <- scRNAexample[,Split_index==i]   saveRDS(Example_splice,file = paste0(set.dirs,"Example_splice",i,".rds")) }  ######### ###1.By celltypes #Create the random index number. for (i in levels(Idents(scRNAexample))) {   Example_splice <- subset(scRNAexample,idents = i)   saveRDS(Example_splice,file = paste0(set.dirs,"Example_splice",i,".rds")) } Pagwas<-list() gwas_data <- bigreadr::fread2(system.file("extdata", "GWAS_summ_example.txt", package = "scPagwas")) Pagwas <- GWAS_summary_input(   Pagwas = Pagwas,   gwas_data = gwas_data,   maf_filter = 0.1 ) #> Input gwas summary data frame! #> No "chr" from chrom!, now pasting it! #> Filtering out SNPs with MAF criterion Pagwas$snp_gene_df <- Snp2Gene(snp = Pagwas$gwas_data, refGene = block_annotation, marg = 10000) title: Proportion of true null p-values — pi0est
text: Estimates proportion true null p-values, .e., following Uniform(0,1) distribution.

title: Proportion of true null p-values — pi0est
code: pi0est(   p,   lambda = seq(0.05, 0.95, 0.05),   pi0.method = c("smoother", "bootstrap"),   smooth.df = 3,   smooth.log.pi0 = FALSE,   ... )

title: Proportion of true null p-values — pi0est
text: p vector p-values (necessary input). lambda value tuning parameter estimate \(\pi_0\). Must [0,1). Optional, see Storey (2002). pi0.method Either "smoother" "bootstrap"; method automatically choosing tuning parameter estimation \(\pi_0\), proportion true null hypotheses. smooth.df Number degrees--freedom use estimating \(\pi_0\) smoother. Optional. smooth.log.pi0 TRUE pi0.method = "smoother", \(\pi_0\) estimated applying smoother scatterplot \(\log(\pi_0)\) estimates tuning parameter \(\lambda\). Optional. ... Arguments passed qvalue function.

title: Proportion of true null p-values — pi0est
text: Returns list: pi0 numeric estimated proportion true null p-values. pi0.lambda vector proportion null values \(\lambda\) values (see vignette). lambda vector \(\lambda\) value(s) utilized calculating pi0.lambda. pi0.smooth vector fitted values smoother fit \(\pi_0\) estimates lambda value (pi0.method="bootstrap" returns NULL).

title: Proportion of true null p-values — pi0est
text: options selected, method used estimate \(\pi_0\) smoother method described Storey Tibshirani (2003). bootstrap method described Storey, Taylor & Siegmund (2004). closed form solution bootstrap method used package significantly faster.

title: Proportion of true null p-values — pi0est
text: Storey JD. (2002) direct approach false discovery rates. Journal Royal Statistical Society, Series B, 64: 479-498. http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/1467-9868.00346/abstract Storey JD Tibshirani R. (2003) Statistical significance genome-wide experiments. Proceedings National Academy Sciences, 100: 9440-9445. Storey JD. (2003) positive false discovery rate: Bayesian interpretation q-value. Annals Statistics, 31: 2013-2035. http://projecteuclid.org/DPubS/Repository/1.0/Disseminate?view=body&id=pdf_1&handle=euclid.aos/1074290335 Storey JD, Taylor JE, Siegmund D. (2004) Strong control, conservative point estimation, simultaneous conservative consistency false discovery rates: unified approach. Journal Royal Statistical Society, Series B, 66: 187-205. http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/j.1467-9868.2004.00439.x/abstract Storey JD. (2011) False discovery rates. International Encyclopedia Statistical Science. http://genomine.org/papers/Storey_FDR_2011.pdf http://www.springer.com/statistics/book/978-3-642-04897-5

what: Estimate the q-values for a given set of p-values — qvalue
title: Estimate the q-values for a given set of p-values — qvalue
text: Estimate q-values given set p-values.  q-value test measures proportion false positives incurred (called false discovery rate) particular test called significant.

title: Estimate the q-values for a given set of p-values — qvalue
code: qvalue(p, fdr.level = NULL, pfdr = FALSE, lfdr.out = TRUE, pi0 = NULL, ...)

title: Estimate the q-values for a given set of p-values — qvalue
text: p vector p-values (necessary input). fdr.level level control FDR. Must (0,1]. Optional; selected, vector TRUE FALSE returned specifies whether q-value less fdr.level . pfdr indicator whether desired make estimate robust small p-values direct finite sample estimate pFDR -- optional. lfdr.TRUE local false discovery rates returned. Default TRUE. pi0 recommended input estimate pi0. Experienced users can use methodology estimate proportion true nulls set equal 1 BH procedure. ... Additional arguments passed pi0est lfdr.

title: Estimate the q-values for a given set of p-values — qvalue
text: function pi0est called internally calculates estimate \(\pi_0\), proportion true null hypotheses. function lfdr also called internally calculates estimated local FDR values.  Arguments functions can included via ... utilized internal calls made qvalue. See http://genomine.org/papers/Storey_FDR_2011.pdf brief introduction FDRs q-values.

title: Estimate the q-values for a given set of p-values — qvalue
text: Storey JD. (2011) False discovery rates. International Encyclopedia Statistical Science. http://genomine.org/papers/Storey_FDR_2011.pdf http://www.springer.com/statistics/book/978-3-642-04897-5

title: Estimate the q-values for a given set of p-values — qvalue

title: Main wrapper functions for scPagwas — scPagwas_main
code: scPagwas_main(   Pagwas = NULL,   gwas_data = NULL,   output.prefix = "Test",   output.dirs = "scPagwastest_output",   block_annotation = block_annotation,   Single_data = NULL,   assay = "RNA",   Pathway_list = Genes_by_pathway_kegg,   chrom_ld = chrom_ld,   run_split = FALSE,   n.cores = 1,   marg = 10000,   maf_filter = 0.01,   min_clustercells = 10,   min.pathway.size = 5,   max.pathway.size = 300,   iters_celltype = 200,   iters_singlecell = 100,   n_topgenes = 1000,   singlecell = TRUE,   celltype = TRUE,   seurat_return = TRUE,   remove_outlier = TRUE )

title: Main wrapper functions for scPagwas — scPagwas_main
text: Pagwas = NULL: parameter typically required need input data. seurat_return = FALSE, intermediate data stored "Pagwas" list returned result. result can inherited used input subsequent calculations. certain scenarios, performing two computations single-cell data input different GWAS data inputs, result list obtained first computation can used "Pagwas" parameter input second computation. allows skipping single-cell calculations, significantly expediting process. However, seurat_return = TRUE, returned result manipulated manner, final Seurat result many intermediate data removed. gwas_data (data.frame)GWAS summary data; must colmuns : chrom|    pos    |   rsid    |   se  |  beta |  maf 6 | 119968580 | rs1159767 | 0.032 | 0.019 |0.5275 10 | 130566523 |  rs559109 | 0.033 | 0.045 |0.4047 5 | 133328825 | rs6893145 | 0.048 | 0.144 |0.1222 7 | 146652932 | rs13228798| 0.035 | 0.003 | 0.3211 output.prefix = "Test": parameter sets prefix output result files. output.dirs = "scPagwastest_output": parameter specifies directory output result files. block_annotation (data.frame) Start end points block traits, usually genes. Single_data (character seurat)Input Single data seurat format, seurat data address rds format.Idents celltypes annotation. assay (character)assay data single cell data use, default "RNA" Pathway_list (list,character) pathway gene sets list chrom_ld (list,numeric)LD data 22 chromosome. run_split (logical) Whether input single cell data split sub-data, TRUE, one result(gPas score) return, FALSE, whole function running. default FALSE. n.cores cores regression marg (integr) distance TSS site,default 10000, gene-TSS-window size 20000. maf_filter (numeric)Filter maf, default 0.01 min_clustercells (integr)use FilterSingleCell TRUE.Threshold total cells fo cluster.default 10 min.pathway.size (integr)Threshold min pathway gene size. default 5 max.pathway.size (integr)Threshold max pathway gene size. default 300 iters_celltype (integr)number bootstrap iterations celltype iters_singlecell (integr)number bootstrap iterations singlecell； parameter "iters_singlecell" used calculate significance p-value individual cells. However, observed step requires significant amount computational memory. Therefore, recommend selecting large value parameter initially.want waste time calculating p-value, can choose set 0. n_topgenes (integr)Number top associated gene selected calculate scPagwas score; singlecell (logical)Whether produce singlecell result; celltype (logical)Whether produce celltypes result; seurat_return (logical) Whether return seurat format result, ,return list result; remove_outlier (logical)Whether remove outlier scPagwas score.

title: Main wrapper functions for scPagwas — scPagwas_main
text: Returns seurat data entries(seurat_return=T): assay: scPagwasPaPca:assay S4 type data; svd result pathways cells; scPagwasPaHeritability:assay S4 type data; gPas matrix pathways cells; meta.data scPagwas.TRS.Score1: column "meta.data";Enrichment socre inheritance associated top genes. scPagwas.gPAS.score: column "meta.data";Inheritance regression effects cells Random_Correct_BG_p: CellpValue cells; Random_Correct_BG_adjp: fdr cells, adjust p value. Random_Correct_BG_z: z score eahc cells. misc: element result,Pagwas@misc  Pathway_list:list pathway gene list intersecting single cell data pca_cell_df: data frame pathway pca result celltype. lm_results: regression result cell. PCC: heritability correlation value gene;previous version, referred Pearson correlation coefficients. bootstrap_results:bootstrap data frame results celltypes including bootstrap pvalue confidence interval. Main Pagwas wrapper functions. scPagwas, single-cell pathway-based principal component (PC)-scoring algorithm named integrating polygenic signals GWAS single cell data infer disease-relevant cell populations score associations individual cells complex diseases.entry point Pagwas analysis. Including data input functions main progress functions; can also output running log parameter log scPagwas, construct folder output. 1.run package linux server, can run export OPENBLAS_NUM_THREADS=1 enter R environment, can help avoid core errors. 2. code kill wrong, can run SOAR::Objects() check objects, run SOAR::Remove(SOAR::Objects()) remove . 3. data big run function(bus error), can split data several sub-data run merge_pagwas merge . library(scPagwas) Pagwas_data <- scPagwas_main(   Pagwas = NULL,   gwas_data = system.file("extdata", "GWAS_summ_example.txt",     package = "scPagwas"   ),   Single_data = system.file("extdata", "scRNAexample.rds",     package = "scPagwas"   ),   output.prefix = "test",   output.dirs = "scPagwastest_output",   block_annotation = block_annotation,   assay = "RNA",   Pathway_list = Genes_by_pathway_kegg,   chrom_ld = chrom_ld,   singlecell = TRUE,   celltype = TRUE) Polygenic regression identifies trait-relevant cell subpopulations pathway activity transformed single-cell RNA sequencing data.(2022) Chunyu Deng functions. scPagwas scPagwas_main, wrapper
